reviews.text: It’s a perfect blend of homage to classic Hollywood musicals, while injecting modern filmmaking and emotion. It’s a beautiful story that evokes ideas that we can all relate with...
reviews.author: JD Duran

reviews.text: Chazelle takes advantage of that vulnerability for the film’s surprising second half, and that’s when La La Land gets real.
reviews.author: Brendan Cassidy

reviews.text: The melancholy in this film's musical sequences serves as commentary on cinema's bygone capacity to produce a unique kind of magic.
reviews.author: Angelos Koutsourakis

reviews.text: This film is a celebration of “the fools who dream.” The world would be a much darker place without those fools.
reviews.author: Tina Kakadelis

reviews.text: I was swept away by the the dazzling, joyous, smile-inducing production.
reviews.author: Keith Garlington

reviews.text: La La Land may seem romantic and wistful, but from the opening sequence onward it balances reality and romance, the frustrating quality of every-day life and the false allure of Hollywood.
reviews.author: Brian Eggert

reviews.text: When discussing the great musicals of all time, La La Land is a film that makes us dreamers remember that anything is possible. Not only can it be added to the list of greatest musicals ever made but to the top of any list as the best film of 2016.
reviews.author: David Gonzalez

reviews.text: Chazelle proved he's not a One Hit Wonder director and brought a huge and ambitious production to fruition, going from the austerity of Whiplash to the bombast of Hollywood musicals [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Luis Bond

reviews.text: The Power of Love vs. White Saviors
reviews.author: Don Shanahan

reviews.text: As effervescent as the finest bottle of champagne, La La Land is an intoxicating motion picture that should particularly please anyone whose heart skips a beat whenever Fred dances on the late show or Judy sings on TCM.
reviews.author: Matt Brunson

reviews.text: It is a simple tale told with such visual inventiveness it reminds audience the power inherent in cinema.
reviews.author: Ian Brill

reviews.text: Chazelle chose his leads well and he couldn't have known that betting on a team that had so much sizzle in the middling Crazy, Stupid, Love would fall flat when he brought them together again.
reviews.author: Cate Young

reviews.text: A gorgeous spectacle filled with beautiful music, lights, and colors. This is the must-see movie of the year.
reviews.author: Leo Brady

reviews.text: Doesn't just breathe new life into an old genre it performs CPR on it, bringing its beating heart back to vibrant life.
reviews.author: Richard Crouse

reviews.text: La La Land is a lovely, pleasing, and showstopping movie that should be watched on the biggest screen, loudest sound, and brightest colors as possible.
reviews.author: Rudie Obias

reviews.text: A celebration of music and magic, where swelling emotions are captured by somber yet jazzy leitmotifs.
reviews.author: Mike Massie

reviews.text: Features a career best performance from Emma Stone.
reviews.author: Richard Propes

reviews.text: La La Land 's biggest failing is its complacency...
reviews.author: Joanne Laurier

reviews.text: The clash of styles and ideas are collectively embraced. It's the balance of cheese meets whimsical. Romance meets heartbreak. An old tradition meets modern ways. A sincere heart meets good fun - and La La Land completely owns it, in its own magical way
reviews.author: Kelechi Ehenulo

reviews.text: It basks in the wonder and excitement of young love, the optimism of the dreamer, the nostalgia of classic Hollywood, and the emotion of musical fantasy.
reviews.author: Allen Almachar

reviews.text: It has a powerful message that lifts you from your chair, pulls you by the ears and forces you to continue with the task of fulfilling your dream. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Ricardo Gallegos

reviews.text: Pairing a filmmaker with maybe the best sense of cinematic rhythm working today with elaborate choreography, old Hollywood style musical arrangements, and two of the industry's most charming performers is a stroke of enchanting genius.
reviews.author: Brent McKnight

reviews.text: The meta qualities of La La Land, which have led many to call it a love letter to classic musical films, owe a great deal to this [atmospheric framing] device.
reviews.author: CJ Sheu

reviews.text: Its charm tells us that the magic of musicals is still more alive than ever. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Yasser Medina

reviews.text: An engaging tussle, an original vision and a wonderful reboot of the Golden Age of Tinseltown musicals.
reviews.author: David Lamble

reviews.text: I have so many feelings about how much I hated this movie.
reviews.author: Avaryl Halley

reviews.text: It was a pretentious waste of my time.
reviews.author: Andrew Galdi

reviews.text: If La La Land brings the genre back to vitality, I'll rejoice. But while much of this movie is clever and enjoyable, I can't say I found it exciting.
reviews.author: M.V. Moorhead

reviews.text: It's exquisite, unforgettable, and utterly heartbreaking.
reviews.author: Steven Prokopy

reviews.text: Damien Chazelle has clearly established himself as one of today's great genre directors in all things musical.
reviews.author: Casey Chong

reviews.text: Do yourself a favor and catch La La Land. It's a necessary reminder that romance, triumph, and hope don't just exist in the movies.
reviews.author: Tim Brennan

reviews.text: La La Land is visually stunning and goes from feat to feat (the opening sequence set on a freeway is one for the books), yet it remains profoundly human.
reviews.author: Jorge Ignacio Castillo

reviews.text: It'll have your heart aching with joy and yearning; its tunes will linger in your brain and hopefully weave a little bit of its magic into your life. Falling in love with it is inevitable.
reviews.author: Charlotte Harrison

reviews.text: An up-beat, enchanting, classic musical...
reviews.author: Sarah Knight Adamson

reviews.text: It's the careful balance between the emotional realism of the acting and the sheer technical audacity of the musical numbers that elevates the movie into the realm of greatness even before Chazelle rips out your heart with the extended, bittersweet coda.
reviews.author: Chris McCoy

reviews.text: [Stone and Gosling] might not have the fancy footwork of Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers, but they're radiant together nonetheless, zinging through their rapport as well as their steps.
reviews.author: Valerie Kalfrin

reviews.text: La La Land triumphs in its simplicity, as Chazelle seamlessly transitions witty dialogue with beautifully choreographed numbers in a heartbeat.
reviews.author: Katie Smith-Wong

reviews.text: [A] glorious, toe-tapping, Technicolor delight!
reviews.author: Debbie Lynn Elias

reviews.text: It's pretty miraculous how lush and flamboyant the movie feels from beginning to end, and it is absolutely a must-see in the theater.
reviews.author: Leslie Combemale

reviews.text: La La Land wants you to take in its beauty and get to know its young dreamers. The ending packs an emotional punch but most of the ride is a joyous visual feast that just wants you to have a good time.
reviews.author: Mark Varley

reviews.text: The characters, the chemistry, the story, the music, the dance, the romance, the view - it all tapped right into the inner recesses of my fanatical love affair with cinema.
reviews.author: Kate Rodger

reviews.text: While the movie is "tongue in cheek" and may not completely live up to the movie musical grandeur of olden days, it is, nonetheless, an uplifting, fun film.
reviews.author: Allison Rose

reviews.text: Here's to the ones who dream.
reviews.author: Michael J. Casey

reviews.text: The director replaces the dances with a sense of rhythm, applying musical mathematics with precision to the cinematographic narrative, its images, the dialogues, carry a hidden musical compass. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Jorge Loser

reviews.text: While La La Land is escapist entertainment for a good chunk, its greatest parts lie in the realities, while not harsh, that plague our dreams. But hey, here's to the fools who dream.
reviews.author: Karl Delossantos

reviews.text: A shameless love letter to a bygone era of cinema, but it leverages that nostalgia to hide a tragic lesson about life and love.
reviews.author: Dominic Griffin

reviews.text: To love La La Land is to do the work for the film it didn't do itself. It requires sanitizing Sebastian, and to a lesser degree Mia, and endowing them with characteristics they never demonstrate.
reviews.author: Ryan Syrek

reviews.text: A ravishing romance, to be sure, filled with romance deliriously exhilarating music and declarations of love in the classic Hollywood vein.
reviews.author: Mattie Lucas

reviews.text: This is a very charming musical with two very likable leads.
reviews.author: Kaitlyn Booth

reviews.text: The takeaway for me is the love story here. At risk of understatement, this is a cinematic love story for the ages. This is a story we haven't seen on screen before, at least certainly not done this well.
reviews.author: Samuel R. Murrian

reviews.text: This movie is going to be in the mix for a lot of big awards.
reviews.author: Dan Murrell

reviews.text: It was wistful, nostalgic and magical.
reviews.author: Rachel Wagner

reviews.text: I left the theater, if not enchanted or swept away then at the very least diverted and perked up. I had been irrationally touched near the beginning by a shot of Stone standing alone on a hilly street in Los Angeles at night.
reviews.author: Geoffrey O'Brien

reviews.text: Go watch La La Land because as clichéd as it sounds, there's something in it for everyone.
reviews.author: Deborah Cornelious

reviews.text: La La Land captures the nostalgic joy of old Hollywood while infusing it with a generous helping of the new.
reviews.author: Allen Adams

reviews.text: Is it possible to fall in love with an entire film, as if it were a fellow human? Is it possible to feel nervous before (another) screening and elated after?
reviews.author: Rahul Desai

reviews.text: La La Land doesn't just have Male Writer Syndrome, it has White Male Writer Syndrome, which prevents writer-director Damien Chazelle's film from living up to its glorious premise.
reviews.author: Andrea Thompson

reviews.text: Romantic and dreamy, colorful and elegant, melancholic, nostalgic and reflective. A breath of fresh air. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Luis Fernando Galván

reviews.text: A romantic musical that blends Old Hollywood fantasy with modern reality.
reviews.author: Nathalia Aryani

reviews.text: "Beyond its music and costume, La La Land is retro in more ways than one."
reviews.author: Li Lai

reviews.text: Damien Chazelle gives this one a visual splendor that vibrates with style and never lacks substance from its wildly charming leads Emma Stone and Ryan Gosling.
reviews.author: James Clay

reviews.text: La La Land  is a melancholic ode to the 'fools who dream' and an overall majestic cinematic experience.
reviews.author: Caroline Madden

reviews.text: ...a vivid smorgasbord of color and life.
reviews.author: Joel Mayward

reviews.text: La La Land is cute, pretty and fabulously entertaining but it's not happy ever after. Hollywood has broken many hearts. There are dreams and then there's reality - but the pull of Hollywood always wins in the end.
reviews.author: Alexa Dalby

reviews.text: La La Land plays like a big ole piece of MGM musical nostalgia. The musical numbers are impressive, with Stone and Gosling both showing incredible range. They sing. They dance. They act. And they do all three very well.
reviews.author: Micheal Compton

reviews.text: La La Land falls ironically foul of the dialectic it is trying so ardently to dramatise.
reviews.author: PJ Nabarro

reviews.text: La La Land is a wonderfully entertaining throwback film that respects the legacy it's drawing from but keeps its eyes on the present.
reviews.author: Jennifer Heaton

reviews.text: The film is a very good movie that is always flirting with greatness yet its songs fail impress on the same level as the intricate imagery on display.
reviews.author: Sean Mulvihill

reviews.text: The love story is paper thin and predictable, but that doesn't matter. It's the sound and the spectacle that will leave you feeling like you've just witnessed a near-perfect piece of cinema.
reviews.author: Nick Pope

reviews.text: It pays [its predecessors] respectful tribute and, most importantly, imparts its nostalgic hankerings to the audience seeing it so that they will be compelled to revisit those old favorites again.
reviews.author: Tomas Trussow

reviews.text: It's a really, really fun movie.
reviews.author: Matt Atchity

reviews.text: It is joyful. It leaps off the screen.
reviews.author: Christy Lemire

reviews.text: It's a lot of music and dancing in the movie and [the stars] aren't great at either; they're okay but not great.
reviews.author: Jackie K. Cooper

reviews.text: As much it is Chazelle's direction that powers the film, it is the chemistry of Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone that ties it all together.
reviews.author: Rendy Jones

reviews.text: La La Land shows us a Hollywood fable of failure and desperation dressed up with a fresh coat of new-wave earnestness and nostalgia.
reviews.author: Jacob Oller

reviews.text: Chazelle has crafted a true modern day classic that reminds us of the power of possibility and of dreams, the belief in love and being in love. It's one of the very best films of the year.
reviews.author: Erik Anderson

reviews.text: It's like a breath of fresh air.
reviews.author: Glynis Costin

reviews.text: A gorgeously photographed, unashamedly nostalgic, bittersweet marriage of the modern and the traditional, proving Chazelle's fantastic eye for musical sequences.
reviews.author: Kambole Campbell

reviews.text: "La La Land" is a wonderful romp back into the dreamy time of Old Hollywood that will make you smile.
reviews.author: Pamela Powell

reviews.text: Charming, alluring, beautiful, and emotionally balanced, "La La Land" is more than a satisfying film; it's an enchanting experience.
reviews.author: Mae Abdulbaki

reviews.text: Borrowing (or repackaging) liberally from 20th century musical titans, La La Land often appears drunk on nostalgia... It's a traditionalist that so longs to be a revolutionary, but not really.
reviews.author: Glenn Heath Jr.

reviews.text: It's an airy confection of delight that is at the same time wised-up and nostalgic. And it aims for a vision of moviemaking that is rhapsodic and earnest without being sentimental.
reviews.author: Kathryn Reklis

reviews.text: La La Land is a throwback film that celebrates the way movies were made and the feelings that came with them, while simultaneously infusing that nostalgia into a glamorized modern Hollywood romance.
reviews.author: Morgan Rojas

reviews.text: The whole thing felt like such a waste of time. I squinted at the screen, trying in vain to find a point.
reviews.author: Rich Juzwiak

reviews.text: When I wasn't charmed by the characters, I was transported by the film's playfulness. The camera bobs and weaves around like a jazz instrument. It's not content to simply film the content. It has to react to it as well.
reviews.author: Damian Levy

reviews.text: Here, the director is happy, but his characters are not.
reviews.author: A.S. Hamrah

reviews.text: Damien Chazelle gives us a human film... [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Ruben Peralta Rigaud

reviews.text: Visually stunning. It makes Los Angeles look a lot prettier than it actually does.
reviews.author: Andre Meadows

reviews.text: Ambitious, hopeful and loving... a celebration of musical culture.
reviews.author: David Keyes

reviews.text: From its exuberant opening musical number, set atop a traffic-jammed Los Angeles freeway overpass, La La Land announces its intention to win your heart through whimsy.
reviews.author: Christopher Llewellyn Reed

reviews.text: Taking his love for jazz music, director/writer Damien Chazelle breathes new life into the old Hollywood musical genre much like 2011's The Artist did for silent cinema.
reviews.author: Kiko Martinez

reviews.text: This is totally a love letter to those old school movies with old school musicals of old-school Hollywood and it does it much better than movies who try to do it now.
reviews.author: Jeremy Jahns

reviews.text: La La Land is the best movie I've ever seen.
reviews.author: Steph Cozza

reviews.text: La La Land is a bit like its Oscar-winning song, City of Stars: it may seem slight, but in the end, it's the little things you remember most.
reviews.author: James Plath

reviews.text: La La Land may not reach the greatness of the classic musicals that Chazelle clearly adores, but to borrow from J.K. Simmons' jazz taskmaster in Whiplash: good job.
reviews.author: Lawrence Garcia

reviews.text: La La Land is a film to treasure and to share. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Jordi Campeny

reviews.text: "La La Land" serves not only as a paean to young love and the thousands of dreamers striving to catch a break every day in LA, but also as a beautiful tribute to the city at its magical best.
reviews.author: Carl Kozlowski

reviews.text: One minute in and I was bewitched. And from there it just kept on getting better.
reviews.author: Lynden Barber

reviews.text: ... an original, distinctive, smart, witty work, whose use of its materials and allusions is utterly contemporary.
reviews.author: Uri Klein

reviews.text: Gosling and Stone are adorable; they comport themselves well enough at singing and dancing, and the effervescence of the work gives their somewhat amateurish routines a shaggy charm.
reviews.author: Al Hoff

reviews.text: Director Damien Chazelle shoots for the stars and then breathtakingly frames his leads dancing together in the moonlight
reviews.author: Robert Kojder

reviews.text: If Gene Kelly, Woody Allen and Steve Martin had a chance to collaborate, the result might be La La Land, the remarkable new movie by precocious young writer/director Damien Chazelle.
reviews.author: Alexandra MacAaron

reviews.text: With its candy-coated color palette and Emma Stone's earth-shattering performance, there's plenty of love found within La La Land.
reviews.author: Kristen Lopez

reviews.text: To call La La Land amazing would be an understatement. Damien Chazelle's new LA-set musical is absolute perfection.
reviews.author: Danielle Solzman

reviews.text: Here it is: the musical that won an Oscar but had the statuette taken away one minute later.
reviews.author: Harvey S. Karten

reviews.text: Gosling shines as a prickly Jazz purist, who conceals his emotions while Stone stands out as the sparkly girl, whose eyes speak a million words. Together they are magical and so is this eternal love ballad that will change the way you look at life.
reviews.author: Renuka Vyavahare

reviews.text: Gosling's effortless-looking performance is relaxed, understated and, thanks to months of piano lessons, totally convincing. But it's Stone who captures the heart, with a performance that runs the full emotional gamut.
reviews.author: Matthew Bond

reviews.text: Stone and Gosling, at the top of their respective games, are delightful to watch together.
reviews.author: Sarah Marrs

reviews.text: The wayward side effect of casting Gosling as this jazz whisperer is that La La Land becomes a Trojan horse white-savior film.
reviews.author: Ira Madison III

reviews.text: La La Land endeavors to show us that while it may take hard work and bitter sacrifice to reach our destination, every choice along the way, including whether or not to keep going, is up to the dreamer.
reviews.author: Emily Sears

reviews.text: It makes it more difficult to just let something like La La Land just passively wash over you when, however well-intentioned, the film hearkens back to a time when black humanity onscreen was deliberately hamstrung.
reviews.author: Soraya Nadia McDonald

reviews.text: La La Land may look like the world that we dream about, but it also understands the cruelty that can come out of (or undermine) those dreams.
reviews.author: Diana Dabrowska

reviews.text: With Hollywood churning out comic book superheroes and sequels, La La Land is a welcome relief, one that is truly original and celebrates music.
reviews.author: Joanne Soh

reviews.text: There is a reason that La La Land is the best film of the year.
reviews.author: George M. Thomas

reviews.text: La La Land engaged my senses in the moment, and will certainly do so any time I watch it, but it will not linger like a haunting refrain. Sadly, it didn't go to my head.
reviews.author: tt stern-enzi

reviews.text: La La Land is a virtuoso production that gives us all something to sing (and dance) about.
reviews.author: Lisa Jensen

reviews.text: La La Land is actually a love story for jazz, with a leading male character who likes to mansplain very loudly and intently whenever he gets the chance about just how important jazz music is and how he will be the saviour jazz music needs.
reviews.author: Rebecca Lewis

reviews.text: Writer/director Damien Chazelle's La La Land offers a delightful, exuberant indulgence in song and dance in the Fred Astaire-Ginger Rogers tradition.
reviews.author: Diane Carson

reviews.text: For all their crazy chemistry, the stars of Hollywood's new musical, La La Land, don't actually sing or dance all that well. Somewhat surprisingly, this actually makes the movie work.
reviews.author: Lili Loofbourow

reviews.text: With its occasional forays into alternate realities and dreamy, keyed-up atmosphere, La La Land plays sort of like a cheerful Mulholland Dr., but shares none of that movie's cynicism.
reviews.author: Megan Burbank

reviews.text: The movie has charm, at least, if nothing else. And as an attempt to pay homage to a vanishing world, La La Land is as dutiful as it is endearing - sweet, if a little sour, too.
reviews.author: K. Austin Collins

reviews.text: La La Land is unapologetically nostalgic for dreams, and the dream factory itself.
reviews.author: Brooke Corso

reviews.text: Damien Chazelle's new musical, La La Land, lacks this secret sauce of musicals: his characters have no particular reason, no real urgency, for bursting into song.
reviews.author: Alex Heeney

reviews.text: La La Land is a heartwarming, but not nauseating, story that will leave you feeling good when you walk out of the theater.
reviews.author: Morgan Baila

reviews.text: La La Land touts itself as a love letter to movie musicals, but it fails to honor the memory of films like Singing In The Rain and West Side Story through its casting choices.
reviews.author: Rebecca Farley

reviews.text: While (the film has) an optimistic, positive message, it loses potency by showing just how little room there is for real life - with all its compromises and challenges - in the dreams of its main characters.
reviews.author: Abby Olcese

reviews.text: This bittersweet musical valentine to Los Angeles - which stars Emma Stone and Ryan Gosling - is delivered with MGM magic and Jacques Demy's earthbound élan.
reviews.author: Graham Fuller

reviews.text: Utterly justifying why it caused such a big song and dance. Joyous.
reviews.author: Robert Martin

reviews.text: It's a story as old as Hollywood and jazz, and Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone feel like a pairing for the ages.
reviews.author: Angie Han

reviews.text: For all that, for all the time and effort the movie took, very little passion comes through.
reviews.author: Rob Gonsalves

reviews.text: "La La Land" takes a city of broken dreams and gives us characters that are willing to take chances in spite of tasting that bitter pill of reality.
reviews.author: Blake Howard

reviews.text: It's a wonderful throwback to the golden era of musicals with a 21st century sheen.
reviews.author: Garry McConnachie

reviews.text: a bright, energetic, buzzy blast of show biz dreams and romantic fantasy, a classic story with a pair of beautiful and charismatic young stars... who meet cute, clash instantly, and dance their way to romance during a walk through the Hollywood Hills.
reviews.author: Sean Axmaker

reviews.text: With its gorgeous visuals, captivating narrative, and phenomenal music, La La Land easily earns its place as the very best film of 2016.
reviews.author: Jeff Beck

reviews.text: La La Land reflects the classic musicals just like Peter Jackson's The Hobbit reflects The Lord of the Rings: you can recognize the inspiration, but can't avoid thinking the originals were much better. [Full review in Portuguese.]
reviews.author: Pablo Villaça

reviews.text: There are so many moments that left me wanting to clap with joy, and the ending managed to both break my swelling heart and make it swell again.
reviews.author: Rain Jokinen

reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, LA LA LAND is fun and cutesy, and made me leave the theater with a big, goofy smile on my face. But there's one distinct difference between good movie musicals and great movie musicals.
reviews.author: Candice Frederick

reviews.text: In the end, La La Land is one of those rare achievements: a movie dream within a dream.
reviews.author: Dan Webster

reviews.text: A film with a scenic exuberance that resembles a patina in primary colors of the very vintage almanac of a disappeared and endearing world, and that tries to mythologize to Los Angeles like the capital of the dreams. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Carlos Bonfil

reviews.text: A huge, ambitious, color-soaked film, it's about 80 percent successful at following through on its goal to bring back the American musical.
reviews.author: Diane Pershing

reviews.text: There's a melancholy to La La Land that makes it linger.
reviews.author: Giovanni Fazio

reviews.text: La La Land doesn't swing. "Hustle and Flow" is a much better musical.
reviews.author: Cole Smithey

reviews.text: A film for the crazy ones who dare to dream, without forgetting the inescapable adversities and the sacrifices that can be quite stormy. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Emmanuel Báez

reviews.text: A film with a nostalgic dynamism that secretes a powerful and calmly positive current that summarizes and unifies all the negative energies. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Jorge Ayala Blanco

reviews.text: An exceptional film that pays homage to classic musicals while building its own instant classic status. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Juan Carlos Ugarelli

reviews.text: Under the inherent optimism of musicals, La La Land hides a melancholic flow that will inevitably will captivate the audience. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Alejandro Alemán

reviews.text: An instant classic that celebrates the city of Los Angeles as well as Hollywood musicals, in the hands of a director and actors who modernize the genre of musicals. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Mario P. Székely

reviews.text: An endearing and friendly film that, among its many successes, confirms in its protagonists two new stars for the Hollywood industry. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Fernando Moreno

reviews.text: The story is solid, albeit a bit predictable at times, the songs, choreography, and costume design are all so stunning, and the cinematography and lighting are the best I've seen in years. Definitely give La La Land a visit.
reviews.author: Anthony Ray Bench

reviews.text: A love story that has a final sequence that is as devastating as, paradoxically, hopeful. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Ernesto Diezmartinez

reviews.text: A fable with an dreamy atmosphere and a realistic and current message. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Anaid Ramírez

reviews.text: The most nominated film of this year's Oscars is also a fresh re-elaboration of musical cinema. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Fernanda Solórzano

reviews.text: La La Land is exciting and amazing, is a modern fable and a musical of the 21st century. It makes you want to continue watching and maybe try some dance steps. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Pablo O. Scholz

reviews.text: It's a pity that La La Land fled from cliche to incur in what is consider cliche. At its best, the movie flirts with the ghosts of professional frustration, only to return to the most rude pretentions. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Daniel Krauze

reviews.text: La La Land gives two hours of pure and genuine entertainment that ratify Chazelle no longer as a promise but as one of the most talented directors on the current scene. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Diego Batlle

reviews.text: An imperfect film but with a lot of identity, and for the Hollywood atmosphere accustomed to formalities, that's very transcendental. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Carlos Caramantín

reviews.text: It's just gorgeous, like a flipbook made of dreamy vintage postcards that are somehow about contemporary life in Los Angeles.
reviews.author: Linda Holmes

reviews.text: La La Land is a beautiful modern homage to the classic musicals from yesteryear and a love letter to all those people struggling to follow their dreams. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Fico Cangiano

reviews.text: A film where every single piece clicks perfectly into place ... there are numerous moments that look and feel instantly iconic.
reviews.author: Matt Neal

reviews.text: The extended final sequence takes everything that has occurred and remakes it so that happiness seemingly lasts for both a few perfect moments and many years. It's incandescent and heartbreaking at the same time.
reviews.author: Craig Mathieson

reviews.text: A sophisticated tap routine on the tombs of the great masters of the genre, taking care not to destroy the tombstones. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Jorge (JJ) Negrete

reviews.text: La La Land offers a warming, renewing sense of magic and hope in the world, the perfect antidote to all the chaos of the present. In the end it's an unapologetically bona fide love affair with love and dreams.
reviews.author: Michael Lee

reviews.text: A film that works like a fine string watch, like a soft and elegant mechanism that breathes the rhythm of jazz melancholy and classic dreams of Hollywood. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Ira Franco

reviews.text: Chazelle's vision of LA is unnervingly whitewashed, and the film could do with another original song, but his inventive cinematography and joyous spirit will leave you inspired -- and dying to see what he does next.
reviews.author: Roe McDermott

reviews.text: A beautiful film that evades corniness and low punches with spontaneous moments of realism and otherwise, is extremely effective as a comedy, romance and musical. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Benjamín Harguindey

reviews.text: "La La Land" deserves all the awards and praises it has received so far, and more. It's an ode to jazz, cinema, theater, classical musicals and love. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Sebastian Zavala Kahn

reviews.text: A film that has a very good choreography and production design but its director/writer spoils much of the democratic and popular pleasure that the great classic musicals of Hollywood used to had. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Diego Lerer

reviews.text: A bittersweet musical with scenarios that suppurate a vintage aura inspired by classic Hollywood and with the brilliant performances of Gosling and Stone. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Carlota Mosegui

reviews.text: A film with a perfect acting combination and explosive musical numbers that would restore faith in the magic of Hollywood and Broadway. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Manu Yáñez

reviews.text: Although it seems a little overrated to me, it's an enjoyable and well made film and entertains.If you like musicals, I recommend it. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Lucero Solórzano

reviews.text: A film that achieves a classic style, evoking musicals from the 30's, 50's and the new French wave, but at the same time it has a contemporary touch. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Adrián Ruiz

reviews.text: A film that goes from a romantic comedy to drama to the rhythm of pop and jazz, while criticizing the frivolity of Los Angeles. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Hugo Hernández Valdivia

reviews.text: A film that causes fascination because is capable of providing a different reading and ending for each individual in spite of the naive ambiguity of its lyricism. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Alberto Sáez Villarino

reviews.text: A beautiful film that touches the soul through its colors, performances, soundtrack, photography, light, and above all, for its story. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Daniel Bernal

reviews.text: Alas, the stylized, wall-to-wall inauthenticity pries out the emotional heart of this modern-day musical fantasy, leaving it needless and empty.
reviews.author: David N. Butterworth

reviews.text: La La Land is cinematic magic in its purest form.
reviews.author: Ben Sin

reviews.text: A rare example of a musical with dramatic integrity; a beautiful dream.
reviews.author: Ed Whitfield

reviews.text: A toasty splash of sound and color .
reviews.author: Tom Shone

reviews.text: Somehow manages to be a feel-good triumph as well as a darkly honest exploration of the quest for fame and romance in Los Angeles.
reviews.author: Rich Cline

reviews.text: Chazelle makes retro chic feel richly contemporary.
reviews.author: Matt Wolf

reviews.text: Joyous, romantic and achingly stylish.
reviews.author: Andy Lea

reviews.text: La La Land remembers when movies were magical and fun, blending nostalgia and contemporaneity in a candy-sweet love letter to cinema.
reviews.author: Erika Balsom

reviews.text: Chazelle's movie is a must-see experience and an instant classic, entirely worthy of the adulation and awards that have come its way.
reviews.author: Rob Carnevale

reviews.text: It's preposterous, ludicrous - and it's exactly the film we need right now.
reviews.author: Stuart McGurk

reviews.text: Chazelle pulls it off magnificently, helped by the fearless commitment of his two leads.
reviews.author: Paul Whitington

reviews.text: It can be exhilarating, thanks to Chazelle's marvelous use of space and color, and thanks to Justin Hurwitz's lovely score.
reviews.author: Jeffrey M. Anderson

reviews.text: A good movie with amazing musical sequences and charismatic protagonists. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Alonso Díaz de la Vega

reviews.text: An old fashioned movie that at the same time is tremendously modern and also nostalgic, romantic, magical and unique. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Lucía Ros Serra

reviews.text: A fizzy surprise.
reviews.author: Camilla Long

reviews.text: A film that starts as an explosion of therapeutic vitality with contagious dance and music admirably filmed while telling a playful and warm love story. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Carlos Boyero

reviews.text: Chazelle has taken a big gamble with this homage. It could have turned out horribly twee and sentimental. Instead the picture celebrates a movie-making form from yesteryear with dazzling visual technique and a huge dollop of charm.
reviews.author: Henry Fitzherbert

reviews.text: It is simply a splendid continuation of cinema's ever-evolving love affair with song and dance.
reviews.author: Mark Kermode

reviews.text: A marvel. Funny and exuberant and bittersweet and cliché-busting and unexpected as hell. We are going to need more movies like this one.
reviews.author: MaryAnn Johanson

reviews.text: Be prepared to go Ga Ga over La La.
reviews.author: Jamie East

reviews.text: Sweet-natured in a time of often bitter cynicism, this buoyantly uplifting fable sets the soul soaring and the heart beating.
reviews.author: Tim Evans

reviews.text: It's not hard to see the appeal - or indeed admire the ambition of Chazelle, who's still in his early 30s (La La Land is only his third movie).
reviews.author: Alistair Harkness

reviews.text: Chazelle takes his cue from past masters of the musicals from Fred Astaire to Jacques Demy. He brings an infectious energy to a film that fizzes like vintage Champagne and has all the colour and sparkle of exploding fireworks.
reviews.author: Allan Hunter

reviews.text: It's as gorgeous in its gloom as in its wonderfully shameless whimsy. It's a dizzying whirlwind of romance and sorrow, cinema to make you swoon.
reviews.author: Emma Simmonds

reviews.text: A film that will possibly become the last hero of a dying genre that everybody will be talking about, at least for a few years. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Quim Casas

reviews.text: An absolute delight, a great musical and an exquisite chant dedicated to love. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Mikel Zorrilla

reviews.text: La La Land ravishes from densely populated beginning to eye-moistening denouement.
reviews.author: Donald Clarke

reviews.text: It's too long, the music isn't great, and I can't stand all the brightly colored twirling skirts.
reviews.author: Molly Laich

reviews.text: The film is at its most convincing in those intimate exchanges between Gosling, with his melted eyes, and Stone, with her anime face.
reviews.author: Ryan Gilbey

reviews.text: La La Land with caveats is still more wonderful than almost anything else.
reviews.author: Deborah Ross

reviews.text: If it were any more enchanting, the musical romantic comedy La La Land ... would break your heart.
reviews.author: Nigel Andrews

reviews.text: The rare kind of spellbinding, wonderful film that has reviewers like me tripping over themselves to find new superlatives for describing it.
reviews.author: Matt Looker

reviews.text: Every moment of La La Land is worth living through because of Stone and Gosling, and Chazelle, whose direction is alive to the thrill of duets, first kisses and getting on with the show, even when you just want to cry backstage.
reviews.author: Bennett Campbell Ferguson

reviews.text: An engaging yet far-from-flawless modern musical...
reviews.author: David Nusair

reviews.text: A formidable film where Stone and Gosling will make you leave the cinema singing and dancing your frustrations away. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Carlos Marañón

reviews.text: La La Land is an ode to those who are brave enough to dream big and for that reason alone it deserves a standing ovation.
reviews.author: Laura Delaney

reviews.text: It's almost impossible not to fall in love with Damien Chazelle's musical masterpiece La La Land.
reviews.author: Marija Djurovic

reviews.text: As a romance it's perfect -- mostly because the two leads have such incredible chemistry -- and as a musical it works even for those who don't love musicals.
reviews.author: Rosie Fletcher

reviews.text: Chazelle's depiction of career conflict and erotic attraction in Mia and Sebastian's romance ... prevents La La Land from being a satisfying movie musical. He imitates the generic form but never imbues it with feeling.
reviews.author: Armond White

reviews.text: Open-hearted gushy romanticism in CinemaScope. What's not to love?
reviews.author: Christina Newland

reviews.text: Audacious, retro, funny and heartfelt, La La Land is the latest great musical for people who don't like musicals - and will slap a mile-wide smile across the most miserable of faces.
reviews.author: Ian Freer

reviews.text: Could have been a grand folly but instead it's just grand. Will make audiences break into grins like its characters break into song.
reviews.author: Jamie Graham

reviews.text: Not just a bona fide masterpiece, but also the best film of the year bar none, capturing the true nature of Hollywood and Los Angeles in a way that's both unconventional and surprising.
reviews.author: Ryan Pollard

reviews.text: La La Land is itself a hugely successful and joyous hybrid of the arts, or to quote the film's rousing opening song Another Day of Sun: "a Technicolor world made out of music and machine".
reviews.author: Damien Straker

reviews.text: For a film that easily could have just been ripe with clichés, La La Land is instead refreshingly different, and is sure to be a hit with audiences as a result.
reviews.author: David Fontana

reviews.text: La La Land's song-and-dance never feels routine, knowing when to soar and when to come, tapping, down to earth.
reviews.author: Brian Gibson

reviews.text: This is a colorful, energetic, vibrant, heartfelt throwback to this once wildly popular film genre, but the singing and dancing isn't really up to the level of the rest of the film.
reviews.author: Robert Roten

reviews.text: "La La Land" is a mirage, a self-satisfied illusion that tries and fails to sanctify a heap of classics that don't require its sanctification.
reviews.author: J. Olson

reviews.text: La La Land is more a companion piece to Whiplash, expressing similarly ambivalent and conflicted attitudes to the creative process.
reviews.author: Ian Barr

reviews.text: La La Land is finely cut, A-grade nostalgia that proves nigh-on-impossible to resist.
reviews.author: Ben Nicholson

reviews.text: Here's to the fools who dream.
reviews.author: Jay Stone

reviews.text: An impeccably accomplished film that is also passionate and vital, and takes formal risks in its unstoppable first forty minutes. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Gonzalo Hernández Espinosa

reviews.text: Surreal, romantic and a strong contender for Best Picture at the Academy Awards.
reviews.author: Linda Cook

reviews.text: This delightful extravaganza revives the big-screen musical -- and how.
reviews.author: Rashid Irani

reviews.text: La La Land is a worthy showcase for the magnificent Stone's talents, and she is heartbreaking throughout.
reviews.author: Gary M. Kramer

reviews.text: Trying to court Mia, Sebastian sings "What a waste of lovely light." Unfortunately, that's about the size of it.
reviews.author: Richard von Busack

reviews.text: A modern lover story with a healthy dose of homage.
reviews.author: Wesley Lovell

reviews.text: It's a slight, often affecting story that mixes the confusion of contemporary life with nostalgic yearning for a time when the whole boy-meets-girl thing was less complicated.
reviews.author: Alison Gillmor

reviews.text: It's an easy film to enjoy, even love. But it's unwise to carry that love to any irrational extremes. Me? I'd be very careful tossing gold statues in its direction.
reviews.author: Jeff Simon

reviews.text: Despite its failings, there's a lot of magic in this movie.
reviews.author: Edward Johnson-Ott

reviews.text: La La Land shows that you can make a highly personal, intimate movie and still use the style of an old-fashioned, cast-of-hundreds musical.
reviews.author: Mal Vincent

reviews.text: If you haven't already fallen for this gauzy romp through the city of Angels at this point, you surely will during the last scene, with its bittersweet homage to the way times goes by.
reviews.author: Karen D'Souza

reviews.text: Anchored by the two great performances from its leads, terrific musical numbers and stylish direction, La La Land is a proper crowd-pleaser and a heartfelt salute to old Hollywood that harkens back to the past in order to create something fresh.
reviews.author: Sandy Schaefer

reviews.text: Of course movie critics love this film; shamelessly referential, it clearly loves movies as much as we do. But don't let that scare you. Chazelle's filmmaking is at once virtuosic and instinctive.
reviews.author: John Serba

reviews.text: [Chazelle's] filmmaking exuberance and the energy and sweetness of his two stars give this thin soup considerable tang.
reviews.author: Michael Sragow

reviews.text: No, you don't need to have seen any of [La La Land's] reference points to find it pleasurable and often exquisite entertainment.
reviews.author: Amy Taubin

reviews.text: This is why we go to movies.
reviews.author: Brad Keefe

reviews.text: Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone are shaping up to be today's equivalent of Garland and Rooney, this third outing (after Crazy, Stupid, Love and Gangster Squad) demonstrating yet again their chemistry and endearing camaraderie.
reviews.author: Sarah Watt

reviews.text: Chazelle's graceful camera work is thrilling, his timing impeccably tied to sumptuous images that are as delightful as the leads on screen.
reviews.author: Jason Gorber

reviews.text: Longing for an old Hollywood musical?... Look no further, movie fan.
reviews.author: Marie Asner

reviews.text: It asks what the characters of a Cinemascope musical would have to dream about, and answers with a finale that lifts the film to a higher plane of wish fulfillment and melancholy.
reviews.author: Ignatiy Vishnevetsky

reviews.text: ...fans of 2011's big award winner 'The Artist' are in for a treat... greater than the sum of its parts. PG-13 for language and criminal use of the a-ha song "Take On Me."
reviews.author: Kevin A. Ranson

reviews.text: The cinematography and special effects are fantastic, but don't actually compensate for a weak storyline, and forgettable musical numbers.
reviews.author: Felix Vasquez Jr.

reviews.text: La La Land is a Christmas miracle for these coldhearted times: a vibrant and emotive present that warms the soul with good cheer as a celebration of a film genre and the indefatigable human spirit.
reviews.author: Kirk Baird

reviews.text: With the first musical number in La La Land, I thought that I was in love. Unfortunately, as is the case with romance in the movie, holding onto that love was more difficult than I at first thought.
reviews.author: Rich Heldenfels

reviews.text: Chazelle combines familiarity with wildly creative execution, proving that style is substance.
reviews.author: Alex Doenau

reviews.text: One from the heart ... Chazelle doesn't for a moment wink at the viewer. He's guileless; he really believes in this trompe l'oeil world of violet sunsets, movie star murals, twinkly planetarium stars.
reviews.author: Glenn Lovell

reviews.text: I don't know if the music will still be sung in 20 or 30 years. I do know that dance schools all around the world are going to see a rush of enrolments.
reviews.author: Paul Byrnes

reviews.text: For those who know The Umbrellas of Cherbourg, it's a harmless curiosity, a workable but rather heavily implied time-travel voyage to 50 years ago; for those who don't, it will probably be incomprehensible.
reviews.author: Kelly Vance

reviews.text: A renovated version of the old-fashioned movie musical about making it big in the City of Stars.
reviews.author: Frederic and Mary Ann Brussat

reviews.text: La Land Land gives us the beauty of the world and its harder realities and intertwines them, leaving us with notes of grace and hope and love that transcend cynicism-bulldozes it, really. And that is lovely.
reviews.author: James Kendrick

reviews.text: As loving a valentine as the film is to old-school Hollywood, the rapturous reception it has received might be a collective reaction against Hollywood's current trends, as enjoyable, breezy and ceaselessly entertaining as it is.
reviews.author: Jim Schembri

reviews.text: Easy on the eyes and tough on the heart, La La Land is a film I could watch again and again.
reviews.author: Matthew Toomey

reviews.text: Any concerns about the experimental nature of this film fantasy are blown away by the sheer talent and attractiveness of the stars.
reviews.author: Jules Brenner

reviews.text: The ideal Christmas Day release gives the gift of its ever-engaging lead couple, music and director Damien Chazelle's surefire Oscar-bound craftsmanship for all to behold.
reviews.author: John Urbancich

reviews.text: ...a film that tries too hard and is always showing how much it's straining.
reviews.author: Daniel M. Kimmel

reviews.text: The mind-blowing opening scene is masterfully shot on the LA freeway.
reviews.author: Dennis Schwartz

reviews.text: While there is much to recommend Damien Chazelle's ode to Hollywood musicals of the 40s and 50s, there were times when I found myself curiously out of step with the rambling, retro production and the self-involved nature of the world in which it is set.
reviews.author: Vicky Roach

reviews.text: The last quarter of La La Land is so beautifully shot and performed, it makes up for the flat opening. It becomes a film that embraces a world where dreamers may seem foolish but eventually are very interesting.
reviews.author: Rick Bentley

reviews.text: La La Land has the best opening scene of the year. It has the best closing scene of the year. What's in between those scenes is merely incredible entertainment and expert filmmaking.
reviews.author: Michael Smith

reviews.text: Chazelle's film, with its unfettered embrace of the imperfect, creates nothing less than a vital symphony of the human condition.
reviews.author: Piers Marchant

reviews.text: The film is full of color, brightness, rhythm and emotion. Although there's a narrative bump in the middle of it, the show gets back on track in a bittersweet, melancholic and radiant final. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Pilar Ayuso

reviews.text: Sometimes a movie comes along that is so different, so refreshingly light, so right for the moment that people can happily forgive it for not being very good.
reviews.author: Ken Eisner

reviews.text: I have yet to meet someone who's watched it and come out in a bad mood.
reviews.author: Jim Slotek

reviews.text: The perfect movie for anyone who needs a bit of cheering up after a bruising year, La La Land is the cinematic equivalent of a really fun morphine trip.
reviews.author: Wenlei Ma

reviews.text: A clever, perfect film.
reviews.author: Russell Baillie

reviews.text: La La Land is not just a musical, but a musical that loves musicals.
reviews.author: Meg Watson

reviews.text: To make an earnest, gleeful song-and-dance musical in 2016 with no political subtext or social commentary, not as a parody or deconstruction but simply as an old-fashioned ode to dreaming, is revolutionary.
reviews.author: Eric D. Snider

reviews.text: People say the movie musical is dead. Tell that that to your tapping toes while watching the enchantment of La La Land, one of the year's best films.
reviews.author: Peter Howell

reviews.text: The beauty of La La Land is that is uses an escapist format to tell a story about professional disappointment and the limitations of love. It's a romance for cynics.
reviews.author: Vincent Mancini

reviews.text: Almost anyone who happens to see it will be converted by minute three. Guaranteed.
reviews.author: Barry Hertz

reviews.text: My heart goes out to Chazelle because of his desires; it sinks at how he's compromised them.
reviews.author: Stuart Klawans

reviews.text: A one-note bore.
reviews.author: Phil Hall

reviews.text: It's deeply derivative yet wholly original, an odd mix that will keep audiences on their toes.
reviews.author: Tom Meek

reviews.text: Audiences find themselves carried away. That may be sensible enough. What's odd is that La La Land is not the merry entertainment it sometimes seems to be.
reviews.author: Calum Marsh

reviews.text: Simultaneously escaping into fantasy and reflecting reality, La La Land proves a big-hearted delight... dream-like in style but ultimately melancholy in sentiment.
reviews.author: Sarah Ward

reviews.text: Stone and Gosling are the perfect pair to sing, soar and charm in La La Land. Now that your chance to see this standout film is finally here, don't miss out.
reviews.author: Julie Washington

reviews.text: La La Land's transportive reverie is its strength.
reviews.author: Tricia Olszewski

reviews.text: Chazelle revitalizes not only a genre but an optimism coming in handy now. La La Land is the movie we didn't know we needed until it's here.
reviews.author: Steve Persall

reviews.text: Envisioning the best versions of ourselves in snappy musical numbers before reality crashes the party.
reviews.author: Cameron Williams

reviews.text: It's simply impossible not to completely fall in love with.
reviews.author: Sophia Watson

reviews.text: Chazelle has reinvigorated the big-screen musical by embracing the present while paying tribute to the past, by balancing irony and innocence, novelty and nostalgia.
reviews.author: Christopher Orr

reviews.text: La La Land is a moving, melancholy musical that's very pleasant, if a bit thin; not unlike its appealing leads' voices.
reviews.author: Simon Miraudo

reviews.text: This year's The Artist. So basically it's a superhero movie for middlebrows.
reviews.author: Sean Burns

reviews.text: Damien Chazelle heard the call: "Make musicals great again." And he's responded bigly with "La La Land," his dazzling display of spectacle and heart that will lock him up -- a front-row seat at the Oscars.
reviews.author: Al Alexander

reviews.text: Can one movie revive Hollywood's musical era AND bring old-fashioned courtship back to theaters? La La Land just might.
reviews.author: Christian Toto

reviews.text: La La Land is a beautiful, inspired film. Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone will leave you with a bounce in your step and love in your hearts.
reviews.author: Julian Roman

reviews.text: Director/writer Damien Chazelle reinvents the Hollywood musical with style and class.
reviews.author: Roger Tennis

reviews.text: La La Land's exhilarating and nearly unflagging energy strives to inspire in viewers an equally bold appreciation for all the things it celebrates.
reviews.author: Anthony Salveggi

reviews.text: When the film ended, I floated out of the theater misty-eyed, cockeyed and starry-eyed. My feet haven't touched the ground since.
reviews.author: Carrie Rickey

reviews.text: As fun as that opening scene may be, the story that follows is what makes "La La Land" a great movie.
reviews.author: Josh Terry

reviews.text: The result is enough to make you leap out of your seat and punch the air in triumph.
reviews.author: Kristian M. Lin

reviews.text: La La Land is magnificent, Chazelle delivering a musical that instantly ranks alongside my favorites of the genre.
reviews.author: Sara Michelle Fetters

reviews.text: Damien Chazelle, the writer/director behind the Oscar-nominated Whiplash, set out to make a musical romance, but his new film La La Land transcends both genres.
reviews.author: Alicia Cohn

reviews.text: The film's opening sequence is jaw-droppingly wonderful.
reviews.author: David Stratton

reviews.text: A terrific modern day musical that often feels like and certainly harkens back to such genre pics of old. (Full Content Review for Parents - Profanity, etc. - also Available)
reviews.author: Jim Judy

reviews.text: Utterly captivating. A seismic event in contemporary American cinema.
reviews.author: James Verniere

reviews.text: The musical romance from writer-director Damien Chazelle is packed with "movie magic," big, un-self-conscious moments where the characters burst off the screen in song and dance. This is a movie in love with movies.
reviews.author: Rob Thomas

reviews.text: [Emma Stone] is so captivating as an actor that we are somehow attentive and interested through lousy songwriting and cliches.
reviews.author: Shawn Hazelett

reviews.text: The film's highs are its light special effects and whimsical choreography. The ensemble cast is phenomenal, but Emma Stone and Ryan Gosling? Not so much.
reviews.author: Valerie Complex

reviews.text: "La La Land" is a special, special experience, and movies like this don't come around too often.
reviews.author: Adam Graham

reviews.text: Much to my surprise, I quite enjoyed La La Land. And I imagine most moviegoers will too.
reviews.author: Sonny Bunch

reviews.text: You have been wronged far too often, I know; the movies have wronged us all. They have stood us up, left us alone on rainy curbs, but you must put your faith in them, one last time. You must run to La La Land.
reviews.author: Rohan Naahar

reviews.text: I could feel the large group of critics at the screening I attended sitting on their hands, resisting the uncouth impulse to applaud.
reviews.author: CJ Johnson

reviews.text: Even with all the awards and Oscars hype, it still won't do enough justice to one of the decade's most magical masterpieces.
reviews.author: Jeffrey Lyles

reviews.text: Chazelle's deep and spacious romanticism includes the city and its dreamers and music and movies and love itself.
reviews.author: Nell Minow

reviews.text: The movie comes off as a well-intended tribute to the fabulous MGM musicals of the great Vincente Minnelli, made by people who have never seen one.
reviews.author: Rex Reed

reviews.text: The swooning, cotton-candy, luxuriantly pastel vibe...has a rather effortful feel, but for those old enough to remember the halcyon days of film musicals, it will be a treat.
reviews.author: Frank Swietek

reviews.text: LA LA Land joins the ranks of other great, hard-working musicals that sit on the periphery of the cinema landscape ... a refreshing reminder that superheroes aren't the only people jumping around in spandex on screens these days.
reviews.author: Patrick Kolan

reviews.text: This is one crowd-pleaser worth getting behind.
reviews.author: Scott Marks

reviews.text: It's simply wonderful.
reviews.author: Richard Roeper

reviews.text: La La Land is more than just a chance to bask in the warm nostalgia of Hollywood musicals. Chazelle captures a feeling reminiscent of the jazz Sebastian so admires: He takes what's familiar, tinkers with it, and creates something new and alive.
reviews.author: Sean P. Means

reviews.text: The transition isn't always smooth; the movie sags in the center as the songs grow sparse. But there are virtues, too -- chiefly the proven screen chemistry between Stone and Gosling. (Their song-and-dance chops aren't half-bad, either.)
reviews.author: Jim Lane

reviews.text: Chazelle's vision to too candied to dismiss, but this extravagance demands more judicious editing, keeping the picture tight and tender. Its current slackness only emphasizes troubling casting faults and dramatic limitations.
reviews.author: Brian Orndorf

reviews.text: Techs are first rate from choreography to production design that creates the perceived fantasy of what LA represents to the young and eager.
reviews.author: Robin Clifford

reviews.text: It's a shame about the rough start to La La Land, but does it really matter when the rest of the film is as assured and, at times, exhilarating as it is?
reviews.author: Mark Dujsik

reviews.text: I believe people when they say they are moved or enchanted by the film; it just didn't move or enchant me.
reviews.author: Robert Horton

reviews.text: La La Land suffers from what it endeavors to celebrate: Hollywood's flair for artifice and self-congratulation.
reviews.author: Jeffrey Edalatpour

reviews.text: Despite his tender years, Chazelle is a master of composition, color and camera movement, and there are shots here so drop-dead gorgeous you wonder how he and cinematographer Linus Sandgren pulled them off.
reviews.author: Robert W. Butler

reviews.text: Working together for the third time, Stone and Gosling quickly establish an easy rapport with one another, their surpassingly attractive physical features the perfect foils for Chazelle's aesthetic approach of naturalism and extreme stylization.
reviews.author: Ann Hornaday

reviews.text: Chazelle is a born filmmaker, and he doesn't settle for rehashing familiar bits from musicals we already love. He's too busy giving us reasons to fall for this one.
reviews.author: Michael Phillips

reviews.text: At a time when musicals seldom grace the big screen, "La La Land" is practically a miracle.
reviews.author: Calvin Wilson

reviews.text: Throughout the entirety of its running time, the film is alive like no other I have seen this year, reveling in its heightened reality and a pure love of cinema.
reviews.author: Greg Maki

reviews.text: (Director Damien) Chazelle has interwoven the innocence and idealism that permeated films in the genre with a contemporary, albeit, realistic vibe that skirts cynicism without passing over the line.
reviews.author: Bob Bloom

reviews.text: The breathless 5 1/2-minute opening musical number in Damien Chazelle's La La Land is worth the price of admission all by itself.
reviews.author: Dann Gire

reviews.text: The musical numbers are distinctly Minnellian in their sense of lovers being swept away by the whirlwind of their mutual regard.
reviews.author: J. R. Jones

reviews.text: It's almost criminal to have to stay in your seat when the contact high of La La Land is goosing you to grand jeté in the aisle. The heart, at least, is at liberty to swell to bursting.
reviews.author: Kimberley Jones

reviews.text: During one musical number, when fireworks start going off in the sky, you can feel them going off in your head too.
reviews.author: Rene Rodriguez

reviews.text: The (Hollywood) Hills are alive again with the sound of (new) music, and it's impossible to not be swept up and away in the sweet sunshine of its movie magic.
reviews.author: Neil Pond

reviews.text: Chazelle creates a realm that suspends disbelief, forestalls cynicism and lets us open our hearts to emotion that's as real in this setting as in any naturalistic drama.
reviews.author: Lawrence Toppman

reviews.text: It's a film for those who feel a little out of step with the 21st century, as Mia does with her love of classic cinema and Sebastian does with his angry jazz certainty. A lot of us can relate. If you can't, we don't really want to hear about it.
reviews.author: Ty Burr

reviews.text: It may not be a masterpiece, but it's a refreshing and unabashed joy-filled escape, and after such a woeful year, there is nothing wrong with that.
reviews.author: Tara Watson

reviews.text: If you have friends who say they don't make good movies anymore, drag them to this.
reviews.author: Bill Goodykoontz

reviews.text: A deft blend of long-gone filmmaking style with decidedly modern sensibilities, it's the kind of film you'll watch with a permanent smile plastered to your face.
reviews.author: Mike Scott

reviews.text: As genres go in and out of style, the movies occasionally forget some of the wonderful things they can do. Luckily, "La La Land" remembers.
reviews.author: Chris Hewitt

reviews.text: Never have the glory days of Hollywood been reimagined quite like they are in the new film by writer-director Damien Chazelle.
reviews.author: Cameron Meier

reviews.text: That not every note or dance step is perfect isn't the point; it's that the actors find perfection - and magic - in the moment, in that flight.
reviews.author: Moira MacDonald

reviews.text: La La Land is hopeful, even giddy. And Chazelle directs with heaps of style and charm.
reviews.author: Max Weiss

reviews.text: Relentlessly stunning and possibly life-altering.
reviews.author: Phil Villarreal

reviews.text: We don't generally think of musicals in these terms, but, following the impersonal splashiness of the opening number, "La La Land" slowly dawns as a film of great intimacy. It's as if it were whispering to us.
reviews.author: Mick LaSalle

reviews.text: It's nostalgic in the same way a hipster combing through vinyl records in a record shop coffee house is nostalgic. It picks and chooses what it wants to remember about the past and puts a decidedly modern spin on the treasures it decides to keep.
reviews.author: Rebecca Cusey

reviews.text: The one thing that Chazelle seems to have little interest in is life. He turns Mia into an absolute cipher, giving her nothing whatsoever to talk about.
reviews.author: Richard Brody

reviews.text: An absolutely top-tier musical and glossy valentine to the simple, blunt-force emotions of classical Hollywood cinema.
reviews.author: Tim Brayton

reviews.text: A spectacular, breathtaking, pulse-racing work of pop art.
reviews.author: Sean O'Connell

reviews.text: Buoyed by the charm and charisma of its talented stars Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone, the film is a whirlwind of unbridled happiness that sweeps us away with music and colour.
reviews.author: Louise Keller

reviews.text: I am a product of the big musicals of the '50's and '60's like "Carousel", "Singin' in the Rain", "South Pacific", "West Side Story", etc. and for me, "La La Land" doesn't come close.
reviews.author: Jeanne Kaplan

reviews.text: The two A-Listers have so much on-screen magnetism --- and they make a nice couple --- I'm willing to overlook their singing shortcomings.
reviews.author: David Kaplan

reviews.text: It's a picture filmmakers have propagated since time immemorial, a valentine to show business itself, and yet filmmaker Damien Chazelle renders it anew in La La Land, an original musical that pays tribute to the city and all it represents.
reviews.author: Robert Levin

reviews.text: A lovely, old-fashioned ode to dreamers and their dreams, the sacrifices they make to go after them, and the poignant regret of what could have been.
reviews.author: Annlee Ellingson

reviews.text: La La Land always feel emotionally direct and natural, rather than cloying, playful or cute. If it's meta, it's also millennial.
reviews.author: Tom Gliatto

reviews.text: A modern love story filmed in a style reminiscent of glorious classic musicals, 'La La Land' emerges as a bittersweet treat for the eyes, the ears and the heart.
reviews.author: Betty Jo Tucker

reviews.text: Heartfelt and ambitious, it won't make you think, but it will put a smile on your face.
reviews.author: Todd Jorgenson

reviews.text: I loved this movie, a sparkling homage to vintage Hollywood musicals, particularly An American in Paris, '50s Hollywood films, like Rebel Without a Cause, Astaire & Rogers dance movies of the '30s, and the City of Los Angeles, just to name a few.
reviews.author: Tony Medley

reviews.text: [Chazelle] is able to maintain enough distance from his influences to infuse the story with touches of realism that ground it while at the same time maintaining a sense of playful whimsy that made its forebears so successful.
reviews.author: Aakash Karkare

reviews.text: La La Land extends a hand to anyone scarred by a barrage of two-steps, jazz hands, and glitter costumes -- and bets are, you'll grab hold.
reviews.author: Matt Patches

reviews.text: As good as La La Land is throughout, the last act elevates the movie considerably. And while everything here has roots elsewhere, the way Chazelle strings these notes together somehow looks and sounds fresh and new.
reviews.author: Brian Lowry

reviews.text: Writer/director Damien Chazelle, whose last film was Whiplash, has made a movie that's visually amazing, awash in vibrant colors, while the camera magnificently swirls around the stars as they sing and dance.
reviews.author: Neil Rosen

reviews.text: The movie ends with a what-might-have-been fantasia that is one of the most emotionally moving passages I've ever seen in a musical. It's like a bluesy jazz piano chord, full of hurt and healing, that slowly fades to silence.
reviews.author: Peter Rainer

reviews.text: Spectacular song-and-dance scenes rise up out of the story like exhalations of pure joy.
reviews.author: Kurt Loder

reviews.text: Profound, beautiful film about love and creativity.
reviews.author: S. Jhoanna Robledo

reviews.text: For all its borrowing and bricolage, La La Land never feels like a backward-looking or unoriginal work. Even when not every one of its risks pays off the way that first song does, this movie is bold, vital, funny, and alive.
reviews.author: Dana Stevens

reviews.text: Peppy, smart, and almost intolerably romantic, this is the finest movie musical since John Carney's 'Once.'
reviews.author: Chris Barsanti

reviews.text: ... a musical so in love with love - and the movies - that only a stone cold heart will fail to get swept up in its glorious romance...The production is a marvel
reviews.author: Laura Clifford

reviews.text: Visually gorgeous and deliciously colorful, La La Land is a romantically fueled, comically fun, and symphonically sublime treasure. You are guaranteed to leave with a smile on your face.
reviews.author: Chris Sawin

reviews.text: It's more vibrant than Chicago, more heartfelt than Les Miserables, and more successfully staged than a chorus of other contenders.
reviews.author: James Berardinelli

reviews.text: "La La Land" is as delightful and magical as you've heard -- a big, joyful celebration of old-school Hollywood musicals -- but it's also smarter, tougher, and sadder than its moonstruck trailer might suggest.
reviews.author: Tim Grierson

reviews.text: La La Land fills your soul with joy and happiness. A dazzling work that you want to see again the very second its over.
reviews.author: Mike McGranaghan

reviews.text: Long live the musical. Bring enough Kleenex.
reviews.author: Jocelyn Noveck

reviews.text: La La Land is a full-service throwback to the Golden Age musical, transposed with lashings of romantic melancholy to a contemporary Los Angeles decked out in primary-colored plumage.
reviews.author: Ella Taylor

reviews.text: Chazelle has assembled a vibrant, infectiously hummable pastiche of musical and cinematic styles - an entrancing ode to the glories of cinema past as well as a heartfelt expression of faith in the medium's future.
reviews.author: Justin Chang

reviews.text: Rejuvenating two tired genres, the romcom and the musical, La La Land amounts to an extravagant and improbable act of resistance against Hollywood convention.
reviews.author: Brian D. Johnson

reviews.text: I'm hoping that La La Land will be a hit for the ages, for all ages. It's a film that re-enacts, with rare originality, a classic role for the movie medium -- escapist entertainment in troubled times.
reviews.author: Joe Morgenstern

reviews.text: As a candy-hued musical valentine to Los Angeles, "La La Land" is both a crowd-pleaser and a locals-only inside joke.
reviews.author: Katie Walsh

reviews.text: Romantic, inventive, visually dazzling - and yet, Damien Chazelle's ambitious movie promises slightly more than it delivers.
reviews.author: Rafer Guzman

reviews.text: Song and dance in the key of life: That's the irresistible appeal of La La Land.
reviews.author: A.A. Dowd

reviews.text: It doesn't so much look back longingly at past masters like Vincente Minnelli, Nicholas Ray, Stanley Donen and Jacques Demy (to name a few) as tap into their mojo, insisting on their modernity and its own classicism in the same gesture.
reviews.author: A.O. Scott

reviews.text: It's stunningly ambitious and thrillingly alive the way the best movies are.
reviews.author: Chris Nashawaty

reviews.text: It isn't merely that Chazelle has made a film with eye-popping color and bold lighting, fantastical sets and characters showing their souls in movement and rhyme. He's made it feel revolutionary and brand new, even when it's as old as the hills.
reviews.author: Stephen Rebello

reviews.text: La La Land is a romance, and everyone is in love with everything -- most of all, old Hollywood dreams. It is, quite simply, magic.
reviews.author: Alissa Wilkinson

reviews.text: This unabashed mash note to the mind-melting majesty of the best movie musicals of yesteryear -- particular those from MGM's golden run in the 1950s -- is nothing less than the best movie of this year.
reviews.author: Leigh Paatsch

reviews.text: I wish La La Land felt more like Chazelle's personal vision - that he tap-danced his own path - instead of this eager-to-please mash-up, the movie equivalent of samba tapas.
reviews.author: Amy Nicholson

reviews.text: One of the fizziest, dizziest, most delightful movie musicals to come around since Fred Astaire spun Ginger Rogers across soundstages.
reviews.author: Josh Larsen

reviews.text: La La Land is probably going to win Best Picture at next year's Oscars.
reviews.author: John Lui

reviews.text: "La La Land" deserves credit for high spirits even if it's essentially a collection of glamorous throwback music videos for so-so songs.
reviews.author: Kyle Smith

reviews.text: For a movie about chasing your dreams in a town known for crushing them, La La Land is surprisingly optimistic up until its bittersweet end.
reviews.author: Jason Zingale

reviews.text: Again and again La La Land cuts to some vibrant vision, and it's often funnier about its outsize old-school ambitions than any cutting critic could be.
reviews.author: Alan Scherstuhl

reviews.text: If you only see one movie this year, you need to get out more. That being said, this endlessly enchanting, panoramic homage to the Hollywood musical is the picture to catch!
reviews.author: Kam Williams

reviews.text: La La does nothing less than jolt the movie musical to life for the 21st century. You leave exhilarated by Damien Chazelle's nonstop inventiveness, dazzled by Emma Stone and Ryan Gosling, and thrilled how they made movies magic again.
reviews.author: Peter Travers

reviews.text: Perfectly acceptable, sometimes overly strained, generally way too basic and, yes, periodically delightful, even at times devastating.
reviews.author: Matt Prigge

reviews.text: More than just a thoroughly modern musical, Damien Chazelle's love story leaves us walking, well, dancing on air.
reviews.author: Joanna Langfield

reviews.text: Just when we were getting ready to write off Hollywood for solely producing noisy, cumbersome and soulless blockbusters, comes this aching, witty and unabashedly romantic musical.
reviews.author: Tomris Laffly

reviews.text: The closest thing since Cherbourg to a unified-field theory of music and film.
reviews.author: David Edelstein

reviews.text: Both old-fashioned and contemporary, the movie understands and celebrates what makes musicals tick. People sing because they feel so much. Emotions have to come out.
reviews.author: Joe Dziemianowicz

reviews.text: La La Land is cute, sometimes gorgeous, but not good.
reviews.author: Kristy Puchko

reviews.text: The film looks good, sounds good and, if you're not too fussy, it might make you feel good too.
reviews.author: Derek Malcolm

reviews.text: For viewers weaned on lifeless Broadway adaptations, there's a good chance La La Land will be unlike any movie they've ever seen.
reviews.author: Scott Tobias

reviews.text: A fabulous old-school Hollywood musical in modern-day Tinseltown with joyous tunes, exceptional choreography, a feel-good love story and a hint of bittersweetness to keep all that wonder grounded.
reviews.author: Brian Truitt

reviews.text: Of the many fantasy spectacles in theaters this December, none are as marvelous as Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone dancing cheek to cheek.
reviews.author: David Crow

reviews.text: Every element of La La Land is bound up in a referentiality that largely precludes the outpourings of emotion we come to musicals for.
reviews.author: Christopher Gray

reviews.text: Catch the film on the largest screen you can find, with a sound system to match, even if that means journeying all day.
reviews.author: Anthony Lane

reviews.text: La La Land is a joyous filmgoing experience, a musical brimming with optimism that never becomes treacly, ably directed by Whiplash's Damien Chazelle and featuring fantastic performances by leads Emma Stone and Ryan Gosling.
reviews.author: Terri Schwartz

reviews.text: Damien Chazelle's musical love letter to Los Angeles manages to be old-fashioned and newfangled at the same time, to thrilling effect.
reviews.author: Kevin Lally

reviews.text: A big, old-fashioned, toe-tapping, earworm-sowing extravaganza. If Gosling and Stone aren't Fred Astaire and Eleanor Powell, well, neither has anyone else been for 70 years.
reviews.author: Bill Newcott

reviews.text: A gorgeous homage to the golden age of Hollywood musicals in the 1950s, the film has the power to make audiences laugh, weep and feel as if they can float on air.
reviews.author: Mara Reinstein

reviews.text: Damien Chazelle's La La Land is majestic, sweeping, and romantic. A beautiful movie musical about our dreams.
reviews.author: Alan Cerny

reviews.text: Unabashedly twinkly and entrancing, affectionately recalling the Golden Era of Hollywood musicals.
reviews.author: Susan Granger

reviews.text: LA LA LAND La La Lavishes with joy and warmth. This is a movie I want to live in.
reviews.author: Chase Whale

reviews.text: We've seen much dumber takes on that stuff in a million showbiz movies, but you'd have to go back to "Singin' in the Rain" to find one that dances around it with the poise that "La La Land" does.
reviews.author: Bob Strauss

reviews.text: The opening and closing dance numbers are so brilliant and uplifting that they are probably the best sequences in cinema all year.
reviews.author: Fred Topel

reviews.text: Giddily ambitious but perhaps more bittersweet than some will be expecting, this melodic love story proves fanciful but rooted, emotionally, in a reality where happily ever afters are not certainties.
reviews.author: Dustin Putman

reviews.text: Stylishly directed and beautifully acted ... this is a gorgeously romantic modern-day musical that will have you grinning from ear to ear.
reviews.author: Matthew Turner

reviews.text: If you haven't succumbed to the joyous magic of La La Land by the end of the Fred-and-Ginger-flavored "A Lovely Night," well, then, pick up your Official Curmudgeon badge and head for the exit.
reviews.author: Steven Rea

reviews.text: A wondrous, magical film that pays constant tribute to a century of musicals and Hollywood films about Hollywood, without ever succumbing to cliché. (Broad Street Review)
reviews.author: Stephen Silver

reviews.text: With a risky method of storytelling, this film fully envelops the viewer in an audiovisual experience that demands an emotional response. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Iván Belmont

reviews.text: La La Land works as a musical, as a romance, as a love letter to old-school Hollywood, and as a thoughtful meditation on the sacrifices that creative people must make in order to share that creativity with us.
reviews.author: Scott Mendelson

reviews.text: Your heart gets tightened, the frog enters your throat, and as soon as you know it, the single tear streams down your face. Stone sums up not just the film's underlying message, but the hopes and dreams of ourselves.
reviews.author: Clayton Davis

reviews.text: Go ahead, try not to fall in love with La La Land. I dare you.
reviews.author: Travis Hopson

reviews.text: La La Land is ultimately a sunshine-filled breath of fresh air which will leave you giddy with nostalgia and happiness.
reviews.author: Amy West

reviews.text: From the set design to direction, the film has a big heart on for golden-age Hollywood.
reviews.author: Kent Turner

reviews.text: La La Land has us with our eyes glued, feet tapping and hearts pounding with anticipation of just what wonder it's going to produce next.
reviews.author: Allyson Johnson

reviews.text: It navigates a delicate line between all of that stylized jazz and an honest-to-God relationship drama, with scenes of conflict and disappointment that are utterly raw and exposed.
reviews.author: Jason Bailey

reviews.text: Chazelle has crafted that rare thing, a genuinely romantic comedy, and as well, a rhapsody in blue, red, yellow and green.
reviews.author: Tom Charity

reviews.text: You won't be able to stop yourself from falling helplessly in love with this over-the-top rom-com.
reviews.author: Tina Hassannia

reviews.text: People complain they don't make em like they used to. Well, they can't say that, anymore.
reviews.author: Stephen Mayne
