reviews.text: A film with marvelous musical numbers and a bittersweet tone that sticks in the viewer's memory after leaving the movie theater. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Oscar Uriel

reviews.text: La La Land is gorgeous, often delightful, and quite satisfying. Its very existence is a triumph, given that an unabashed throwback A-list musical could not have been an easy sell, even for someone coming off of such significant hype.
reviews.author: Sarah Kurchak

reviews.text: The craft of La La Land is impeccable, from the energetically active camera to the staging and production design that re-creates the past without feeling dated. But there's a reckless cockiness to the production as well.
reviews.author: Tasha Robinson

reviews.text: Chazelle creates something absolutely unforgettable. Few people will be able to see this movie only once.
reviews.author: Edward Douglas

reviews.text: La La Land is a technicolor fantasy you have to see on a big screen. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Erick Estrada

reviews.text: There is no way for me to explain this movie's pleasures in a way that makes sense.
reviews.author: Stephen Marche

reviews.text: La La Land serves to remind us that movies can still be magical, and they can still provide the channel for us to see magic in the world around us.
reviews.author: Brian Tallerico

reviews.text: Restores the movie musical to its former glory.
reviews.author: Matt Singer

reviews.text: Working as something of a love letter to classic Hollywood, and celebration of cinema in its purest form - this feature somehow manages to avoid feeling imitative, nor like a mere pastiche - which is of huge commendation to the director.
reviews.author: Stefan Pape

reviews.text: La La Land isn't mere homage. It captures the soul of the genre, creating a bright, colorful portrait of love and art that miraculously retains its optimism in the face of reality.
reviews.author: Noah Gittell

reviews.text: My goodness is La La Land magical.
reviews.author: Emily St. James

reviews.text: La La Land is what they call a "humdinger" of a movie.
reviews.author: Mike Ryan

reviews.text: A dazzling, magical film.
reviews.author: Chris Bumbray

reviews.text: Not once do you feel like you're watching red-blooded characters, so much as you are the good-natured, tirelessly committed actors playing them.
reviews.author: Keith Uhlich

reviews.text: An enchanting composition, a magical musical indeed.
reviews.author: William Bibbiani

reviews.text: A wooning, glorious tribute to the risky pursuits of fame, art and love, not necessarily in that order.
reviews.author: Norman Wilner

reviews.text: La La Land begins with such an ecstatic rush of joy -- and ends with such a gloriously bittersweet flourish -- that you kinda can't blame the film for sagging a bit in the middle.
reviews.author: Richard Lawson

reviews.text: Arguably one of the best romantic films made since cult favorite Amélie.
reviews.author: Kaleem Aftab

reviews.text: Step Up 6: Awards Season
reviews.author: Walter Chaw

reviews.text: The journey has some fits and starts, but the destination is pure movie magic.
reviews.author: Brian Formo

reviews.text: Most cinema-goers are already madly in love with at least one of them, and that love will hit stratospheric new heights when they see how skilfully Gosling and Stone balance their absurd attractiveness with goofy self-deprecation in La La Land.
reviews.author: Nicholas Barber

reviews.text: Breaking into song and dance can be both deadly serious and a whole lot of fun.
reviews.author: Dave Calhoun

reviews.text: La La Land isn't perfect, but it's still a joy.
reviews.author: Brian Viner

reviews.text: The lion's share of the kudos must go to Chazelle, who's achieved something truly extraordinary here: an achingly romantic movie-musical that makes the old new again.
reviews.author: Marlow Stern

reviews.text: Damien Chazelle's La La Land is a wildly ambitious widescreen musical drama that, at its best, hits some very high notes indeed.
reviews.author: Geoffrey Macnab

reviews.text: A heavenly musical filled with down-to-earth humour.
reviews.author: Kate Muir

reviews.text: La La Land feels like a throwback and also like something we've never seen before, resulting in a dreamy musical that hits just about every note.
reviews.author: Darren Ruecker

reviews.text: La La Land is a monster musical, embracing every cliche about the hopes and frustrations of young talent in Hollywood as if they were all newly minted.
reviews.author: David Sexton

reviews.text: It has its head in the stars, and for a little over two wonderstruck hours, it lifts you up there too.
reviews.author: Robbie Collin

reviews.text: It's a movie with the potential to make lovers of us all. All we have to do is fall into its arms.
reviews.author: Stephanie Zacharek

reviews.text: Technicolor escapism doesn't come much better than this.
reviews.author: John Bleasdale

reviews.text: A celebration of nostalgia and heartbreak. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Luis Martínez

reviews.text: A beautiful, audacious, aesthetically vibrant, and enchanting contemporary musical.
reviews.author: Rory O'Connor

reviews.text: A gorgeous romantic fever dream of a movie musical. La La Land is one for this age - and the ages. Stunning in every way.
reviews.author: Pete Hammond

reviews.text: "La La Land" is magically in tune with its reference points even as falls a few notes short of their greatness.
reviews.author: Eric Kohn

reviews.text: An absolute triumph. 'La La Land' is a film you simply never want to stop watching.
reviews.author: Jessica Kiang

reviews.text: For Chazelle to be able to pull this off the way he has is something close to remarkable.
reviews.author: Todd McCarthy

reviews.text: The most audacious big-screen musical in a long time, and - irony of ironies - that's because it's the most traditional.
reviews.author: Owen Gleiberman

reviews.text: Chazelle's dream-like follow-up to Whiplash is as la-la-light as its title, tap-dancing its way into the hearts of incurable romantics everywhere.
reviews.author: Fionnuala Halligan

reviews.text: La La Land is such a happy, sweet-natured movie - something to give you a Vitamin D boost of sunshine.
reviews.author: Peter Bradshaw

reviews.text: The musical is as malleable and eclectic a genre as any other, and Chazelle reminds us how effectively it can be applied to intimate moments as well as huge ones.
reviews.author: Alonso Duralde

synopsis: Sebastian (Ryan Gosling) and Mia (Emma Stone) are drawn together by their common desire to do what they love. But as success mounts they are faced with decisions that begin to fray the fragile fabric of their love affair, and the dreams they worked so hard to maintain in each other threaten to rip them apart.
